title: Find the Length of a String

challengeFiles.name: script

solutions.name: script

tests.text: You should not change the variable declarations in the // Setup section.
You should be getting the length of lastName by using .length like this: lastName.length.

description:
You can find the length of a String value by writing .length after the string variable or string literal.

console.log("Alan Peter".length);

The value 10 would be displayed in the console. Note that the space character between "Alan" and "Peter" is also counted.

For example, if we created a variable const firstName = "Ada", we could find out how long the string Ada is by using the firstName.length property.
instructions: Use the .length property to set lastNameLength to the number of characters in lastName.
